subject: Marketing
title: The Influencer Effect
description: A quick win: understand The Influencer Effect.

hook.text: A YouTuber mentions a skincare product. It sells out in 48 hours.

buildup.text: Influencers combine the trust of word of mouth with the reach of advertising.

discovery.text: Micro-influencers with 10K followers often drive more purchases than celebrities with millions.

twist.text: Audiences can detect fake endorsements. The moment it feels paid, trust collapses.

climax.text: The most effective influencer partnerships feel organic because the influencer genuinely uses it.

punchline.text: Influence without authenticity is just noise.

quiz.question: Why do micro-influencers often outperform celebrities in driving purchases?
options: Their smaller audiences trust them more and see them as relatable
They charge more, so brands invest more effort
Celebrities never use social media platforms
